However, serverless does introduce a new paradigm in how applications can be built. Learn best practices, tips, and tricks from the product manager of Azure Functions based on learnings from real-world use cases around the world.

sessions.name: SIGNALR: REAL-TIME FOR ALL THE THINGS
sessions.description: You may know a bit about SignalR from its upbringing as the real-time framework for .NET. While still true in that SignalR for .NET Core is a thing now, SignalR has evolved and is no longer “just for .NET developers.” With the new Azure SignalR Service providing a common back-end for any real-time app needs you have, you can use the various client SDKs now available for SignalR – JavaScript and Java, to name a few – without any .NET Code. In addition, there is a multitude of support for new serverless opportunities you can tap into with SignalR, like the new SignalR bindings for Azure Functions. With other advanced capabilities in SignalR like non-JSON payload support and streaming, it’s never been a better time to do real-time than right now. In this demo-heavy, interactive session you’ll be up and running with SignalR in new and more exciting ways.

sessions.name: SURVIVING MICROSERVICES
sessions.description: Ah, the promises of Microservices. Small manageable services. Independent life cycles. More features, faster, and with fewer regressions. Unlimited scale. Asynchronous messages. Events and messaging strategies. Audit and history. Eventual consistency bliss. Containers everywhere. It sounds fantastic right? And, it can be, for some. Will you be one of them? This session will contemplate how to survive this seductive approach toward solution architecture - with the many pitfalls in mind - and with the reasons why it's worth the effort.

sessions.name: WRITE ONCE, RUN ANYWHERE!
sessions.description: The open source Ionic Framework features a rich library of front-end building blocks and UI components that make it easy to design beautiful, high-performance mobile and Progressive Web Apps (or PWAs) using web technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Our universal web components pair with any JavaScript framework, including Angular, React, Vue, or no framework at all (just add a script tag!). Ionic apps are backend agnostic, with connections to AWS, Azure, and Firebase. With this session, we are going to look at how with using the Ionic Framework you can build an application that you write once and run on any device, iOS, Android, UWA, Browser, and/or desktop.

sessions.name: Break
AZURE SQL DATABASE HYPERSCALE: UNLIMITED VLDB SCALE WITHOUT THE VLDB HEADACHES
sessions.description: We'll talk about the new Hyperscale service tier of Azure SQL Database, and how it achieves virtually unlimited scale, while enabling fluid scaling of resources, and avoiding the headaches normally associated with very large databases. We'll discuss the architecture behind the features, as well as some concrete, real-world examples of customers deploying Hyperscale today.

sessions.name: INSIDE SQL SERVER CONTAINERS
sessions.description: Containers are the “new virtual machines”. Containers present a new way to deploy, manage, and run SQL Server never seen before. Come learn the fundamentals of the promise of containers, how to deploy containers with SQL Server, and the wizardry of patching SQL Server in a new way that will leave you amazed and wanting to know more. You will see live demos of using SQL Server containers and understand why they actually compliment your virtual machine investments.

sessions.name: MIGRATION STRATEGIES
sessions.description: Migrating and upgrading SQL Server is much more complex than running setup.exe, or at least it should be. Each version of SQL Server has brought us new features and performance improvements. We have several tools to help us check for compatibility and performance improvements/degradations. These tools can help evaluate hardware upgrades as well as SQL Server versions. This session will cover lessons learned from in-place upgrades and migrations and how you can prevent many of the same mistakes. This session will take demonstrate the benefits of using Database Experimentation Assistant as well as Database Migration Assistant.

sessions.name: MINIMAL MEAN: FULL STACK TYPESCRIPT
sessions.description: TypeScript is JavaScript that scales, ready for your personal projects and the enterprise. In this session, we will use TypeScript with Angular, Node and MongoDB to stand up a full stack application from scratch, while sticking close to the metal and avoiding unnecessary libraries or tools. We will then containerize the individual layers using Docker, followed by full stack deployment automation with Docker Compose and AWS ECS. Seeing how the stack is put together will enable you to use the GitHub "excellalabs/minimal-mean" project as a seed project to get you started and deployed on the cloud.

sessions.name: PRACTICAL GUIDANCE TO MAKE YOUR TIER-1 SQL SERVER ROAR
sessions.description: Whether you are new to managing SQL Server or a seasoned database administrator, you may be unsure of the latest and greatest recommendations for configuring and maintaining a high-performance tier-1 database system. As we approach the impending need to modernize your SQL Server 2008/2008R2, the SQL Server team lays out the current guidance for configuring and tuning SQL Server on modern, high-end hardware. Topics include, but are not limited to, tempdb configuration, disk configuration, memory configuration, trace flags, Query Store, tools, automatic tuning, and index/stats maintenance.

sessions.name: Lunch
Lunch
ANGULAR SCHEMATICS - THE UNKNOWN HERO
sessions.description: Behind every great tool is a great library. Schematics is the unknown hero behind Angular CLI but also some upgrade tools. Ever wondered how scaffolding a component really happens or how you would insert some code in just the right place in the code file? Wonder no more. This session is about showing what Schematics can do and how you can build your own Schematics that will scaffold or change code in existing files or something else, everything to your bidding.

sessions.name: AZURE SQL DATABASE MANAGED INSTANCE: THE MOST COMPATIBLE PLATFORM AS A SERVICE DATABASE ON THE PLANET
sessions.description: We will discuss Azure SQL Database Managed Instance, a new deployment model which provides full SQL Server compatibility, removing almost all migration blockers when moving from on-premise SQL Server to an Azure PaaS SQL offering. We'll go into the architecture, capabilities, and limitations of the technology, and demonstrate migrating an application from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database Managed Instance.

sessions.name: BEYOND HELLO WORLD - COMMON MACHINE LEARNING USE CASES WITH ML.NET
sessions.description: ML.NET is an open source and cross-platform machine learning framework built for .NET developers. You can use your .NET and C# or F# skills to easily integrate custom machine learning into your applications without any prior expertise in developing or tuning machine learning models. In this talk we will write code in ML .NET to build the use cases around sentiment analysis, price prediction, Product recommendation, Customer segmentation, Spam detection, and sales forecasting to showcase the power and ease of framework.

sessions.name: BUILDING BETTER AGILE SPRINT PLANS
sessions.description: If you are challenged with creating rapid, solid sprint plans and struggling with mid-sprint issues, incomplete work at the end of a sprint, the treatment of bugs and when to apply ‘spikes’ then this session is for you. In this session, Building Better Agile Sprint Plans, you will learn the skills, approaches, and techniques to advance your essential sprint planning capabilities. First, we will quickly review key Agile, Scrum and sprint terms, definitions, roles, artifacts and processes to provide the basis for this session and cover the numerous benefits of having a solid Agile planning process and what the outcomes and expectations of sprint planning should be. Next, you will learn the activities regarding the product backlog, user stories, sprint planning, sprint backlog, the sprint itself, daily scrum or stand up, the potentially shippable product and lastly the sprint review and retrospective. Included will be sprint management activities such as sprint status, burndown, and developing velocities. Finally, this session will not only cover the “happy path” planning process, but once the sprint is launched and is “in-flight,” we will explore how to handle the myriad of issues that may affect and impede your plan, such as: bugs, staffing, ‘spikes’, and incomplete work and what options you can apply to mitigate them. When you’re finished with this session, you will have the skills and knowledge of how to improve, execute and deliver high quality sprint plans; and what options you have if things ‘go wrong.’

sessions.name: BULLETPROOF TRANSIENT ERROR HANDLING WITH POLLY
sessions.description: Connected applications only work when connected. What happens if the network breaks temporarily? Will your system recover smoothly or pitch a fit? Using an OSS project called Polly (available on GitHub) you can handle this and many other transient situations with elegance and fluency. Polly lets you define retry policies using standard patterns such as retry, retry forever, wait and retry, and circuit breaker. Learn how to make your system bulletproof with Polly and a little know-how.

sessions.name: COMPLETE DATABASE MIGRATION WITH POWERSHELL
sessions.description: With SQL 2008 going out of support this year, there is a greater need to migrate to a more recent version. There are many ways to do this, but I am here to introduce you to the DBATools module in PowerShell. There is a complete set of commands that make migration a breeze. Not only full migrations, but even in pieces. Copying Logins, Linked Servers, Jobs is simple with this module. I will show you how you get your environment set up to use it as well as perform a full migration right before your eyes. Whether you are dealing with 1 server or multiple servers, these commands work great. I will actually show you a complete migration in our time in this session. This will be the best hour you’ve spent in a long time. Join me for a fun filled time to become a PowerShell DBA.

sessions.name: DEPEND ON DOCKER FOR SCALE ON AZURE
sessions.description: Depend on Docker is a series of talks that started at DockerCon 2018. These talks converge to the point that the only first order dependency you need for all your software projects is Docker. This talk focuses on running containers at scale on Azure. We will share our experience and lessons learned while running thousands of containerized workloads in parallel, as well as show a use case, architecture, and demonstration of a massively parallel container orchestration system.

sessions.name: MACHINE LEARNING THE .NET WAY
sessions.description: ML.NET is a free, cross-platform, and open source machine learning framework for .NET developers. It is also an extensible platform that powers Microsoft services like Windows Hello, Bing Ads, PowerPoint Design Ideas, and more. This session focuses on what’s new with the ML.NET 1.0 release and through a variety of demos describes how to build custom ML models like issue classification, object detection and recommender systems from scratch. This session will also introduce the newly added AutoML support, Visual Studio tooling experience and support for Deep Learning with ML.NET. This is one demo rich session and a great way to get a jump start with Machine Learning using ML.NET!

sessions.name: MICROSERVICES 101 - GETTING STARTED WITH .NET CORE AND KUBERNETES
sessions.description: With .NET Core, developers can build high-performance applications that scale using containerization, and the tools built in to Visual Studio and Visual Studio Code that make it easy to package applications and deploy them to Kubernetes. When you pair these tools with the built-in microservice support .NET Core offers with advancements like Health Checks and a flexible configuration model, you'll learn how to adapt your code to make use of the features the Kubernetes engine provides. If you've been wondering how to start building applications for microservices but have been intimidated by the barrage of tools and options, start with this session to get your feet wet building microservices with .NET Core.

sessions.name: QUERY STORE IN SQL SERVER 2019
sessions.description: Getting query performance monitoring right, even with the excellent tools available, can be a struggle. Don't you wish you could just flip a switch and have the query metrics gathered for you? Well, with the Query Store, you can do exactly that. What’s more, the Query Store is a vital part of any upgrade from a previous version of SQL Server (especially any prior to SQL Server 2014). This session will cover the information that Query Store gathers and how it is gathered. You’ll also learn how Query Store takes an active and direct role in your upgrade path to SQL Server 2019. The information in this session will empower you to more easily monitor query performance, respond to regressions of that performance and more easily upgrade your SQL Server databases, all at the flick of a switch.

sessions.name: SECURING CALLS TO WEB APIS FOR JAVASCRIPT/SPA APPLICATIONS
sessions.description: Modern web development means that more and more application code is running in the browser as JavaScript. This architectural shift requires us to change how we perform authentication and authorization. Fortunately, using modern protocols such as OpenID Connect and OAuth 2.0 you don’t need to invent your own solution for this new environment. This session will show you the modern approach for browser-based JavaScript applications to authenticate users, and perform secure web API invocations. As you might expect, security is sufficiently complex and so even modern security comes with its own set of challenges. Luckily, we will show off some libraries that help manage this complexity so your application doesn’t have to.

sessions.name: THE SCIENCE OF GREAT UI, PART 3 (METRICS AND BUSINESS CASE)
sessions.description: Think great UI/design is subjective? Is your organization reluctant to invest in improving user experience? See definitive methods, ranging from brain-dead simple to mind-blowingly high-tech to help you measure design quality. Learn how to find and use freely-available tools to analyze design quality. Mark will also show how to present a compelling business case to justify investment in great design. Part 3 of 3.

sessions.name: WRITING FAST, SAFE DYNAMIC T-SQL
sessions.description: Your users want one query that does EVERYTHING, like searching products by size, color, stock quantity, price, and more. You've tried using OR, COALESCE, and ISNULL, and you just can't get your queries to perform well. In this all-demo session, we'll build dynamic SQL the professional way, making sure that SQL Server uses indexes when it can, make our troubleshooting as easy as possible, and avoid SQL injection.

sessions.name: LEVERAGING ANGULAR CONCEPTS IN NODE.JS WITH NEST
sessions.description: Angular empowers us with a robust platform that simplifies structuring highly scalable and demanding applications. Nowadays, rapidly changing technologies force us to constantly learn new things. But, what if we could reuse our existing experience? Share language, design patterns, main principles? In this talk you'll learn how Nest can increase your productivity and how to start your journey to become a Full-Stack TypeScript developer.

sessions.name: Ice Cream Break
Ice Cream Break
Bridging the Gap between document intelligence and actionable insights.
sessions.description: : In this session attendees see an end-to-end solution leveraging Azure Cognitive Services to extract, enrich, combine and transform intelligence from documents into actionable insights . Behind the scenes it leverages Forms Recognition, Multi-label classification, Knowledge Store, Computer Vision and Cognitive Search.

sessions.name: BRINGING APACHE SPARK TO .NET
sessions.description: Open Source Big Data platforms, and especially Spark, have become increasingly popular with programmers to build big data pipelines and enable in-depth data investigations with machine learning algorithms. Unfortunately, they are not easily usable for programmers with a .NET background and often requires them to learn another language such as Python or Scala. In this session, we would like to introduce you to our ongoing work of bringing Spark to the .NET programmers. We will be taking you through the motivation on why we are adding .NET support to Spark, outline our roadmap and give you examples of the Spark .NET experiences, including creating Spark jobs from .NET, using .NET to write user-defined functions and call them from Spark and Spark SQL, and writing a Spark structured streaming pipeline in .NET.

sessions.name: COMPARING AZURE MESSAGE DELIVERY SERVICE OFFERINGS: WHEN TO USE WHICH ONE?
sessions.description: Azure provides three services designed to deliver event messages: Event Grid, Event Hubs, and Service Bus. While there are some similarities between these services, each is designed for particular scenarios. This session will describe the differences and similarities between these services and provide guidance on which one to choose for your application. In addition, we will examine cases where they can be used together, along with how they compare when used for similar tasks.

sessions.name: DEBUGGING NODE: AN UNEXPECTED JOURNEY
sessions.description: How long did it last take you to debug and fix an issue? What if you could cut down on that time? If you choose your debugging approach wisely, you'll positively affect your efficiency in problem-solving. Let's look at the options and maybe even learn some new ones you didn't know. We'll explore console logging, node inspector and debugging right where you code. Level up your skills to be able decode defects in your apps.

sessions.name: IMPROVE YOUR TESTING WITH VISUAL STUDIO 2019
sessions.description: We’ve made several improvements to the test experience in Visual Studio to help developers write tests effectively. Come learn about the new test explorer features including better sorting, filtering, and a customizable hierarchy view! This talk will also cover some main principles of testing we think about when developing testing tools. You’ll also see demos on test generation with IntelliTest, code coverage tools, and the latest in Live Unit Testing. This talk will be demo-packed with lots of productivity tips and tricks along the way.

sessions.name: MIGRATING & MODERNIZING LEGACY APPLICATIONS USING CONTAINERS
sessions.description: Gain some significant benefits from the cloud without changing the core architecture of your application. During the initial modernization, add additional services to increase reporting and logging services like Application Insights or implement CI/CD using Azure DevOps. During this talk, discover the options containers offers for scalability and deployment ease for legacy apps to pave a path to modernization.

sessions.name: RUNNING .NET CORE IN SMALL ENVIRONMENTS, LIKE RASPBERRY PI AND CONSTRAINED CONTAINERS
sessions.description: After years of optimizing .NET to run on big servers, we’re now making .NET Core work well in small environments, like memory constrained Docker containers and Linux cgroups. We recently added support for ARM chips, which makes it possible to run .NET on Raspberry Pi devices, including programming GPIO and PWM pins. We’re working on enabling an ecosystem of device bindings that can be used with sensors and LCD/LED panels. We are currently working with customers from around the world to use .NET in new industrial applications where resource constraints are a big factor that .NET Core needs to accommodate. Learn how you can use .NET Core in small environments.

sessions.name: WHAT'S HAPPENING IN MY APP, APPLICATION INSIGHTS?
sessions.description: Azure Application Insights helps you to detect issues, diagnoses crashes and track your application usage in your application, both web, and mobile. Let’s see how you can get alerts on performance and availability issues, monitor our applications usage and performance, get telemetry for our application without needing to redeploy the applications, search traces, and exceptions logs to figure out what is wrong. Oh, did I mention we can monitor Android, iOS, Windows Mobile applications as well as ASP.NET applications? We’ll also take a look at how we can analyze request load, server performance counters and response times across dependencies. Get multi-dimensional analyzes over standard metrics or define your own. Diagnose exceptions, mobile application crashes, and failed requests, correlating with events and traces.

sessions.name: SentryOne Tolls for Productivity and Performance
Expo Area Open
Expo Area Open
Security After Dark
sessions.description: Hosted by Michele Bustamante & Brock Allen

sessions.name: SQLafterDark
sessions.description: Hosted by Kimberly L. Tripp and Paul S. Randal

sessions.name: Continental Breakfast
The Mechanics of SQL Server
What's New in Angular
sessions.description: Keynote by Brad Green Learn about the latest features in version 8 of Angular, learn how the Angular team sees the ecosystem and the industry, and where we're headed in the future.

sessions.name: Coffee Break
ARCHITECT YOUR APP SECURITY AND ACCESS MANAGEMENT
sessions.description: In this session we take help you design your applications and APIs to be able to secure them and help you identify the different security strategies you can use to protect your APIs, we will cover things like Role Based Security, delegated permissions, scopes, azure API management, authorization strategies and more. It doesn’t matter if you host your applications in Azure or other cloud back ends, doesn’t matter what language you use to build your solutions. This session is relevant for any developer and architect.

sessions.name: BUILDING API SERVICES FOR BUSINESS APPLICATIONS
sessions.description: Back-end systems of record are often too complex to expose directly to the web. They are stable, hardened and dependable but they are often based on legacy technologies and not always easy to expose to Web standards like HTTP. During this session, we will look at how to evaluate existing systems and build an API.

sessions.name: COGNITIVE SERVICES - MACHINE LEARNING FOR DEVELOPERS
sessions.description: Machine Learning is a big topic. A lot of its practitioners are data scientists with PHDs in Math and/or Machine Learning. As a developer you can enjoy the fruits of their labour in the form of Microsofts Cognitive Services. It consists of set of APIs that can do everything from text analysis/recognition, object recognition, even analyzing videos and much much more. So many cool and useful APIs and areas of application. The choice is yours wether you want to develop the latest search and rescue software or maybe a modern "babelfish", a translator for all the major languages of the world. This session will showcase how you as a developer can build some really amazing apps given these APIs that you didn't think possible. The future is now

sessions.name: CYPRESS: WHERE AUTOMATED WEB UI TESTING ISN’T JUST FOR QA ANYMORE
sessions.description: Today’s fast-moving software delivery environment emphasizes pushing value to production as quickly as possible. “Value to production” implicitly requires high quality—low quality is of little value to anyone! —which means teams need to focus on being able to specify, build, test, and deploy software effectively and quickly. Acceptance testing historically been manually intensive efforts run by a dedicated QA department, resulting in a slower pace of production releases. No longer do we have to make acceptance a manual effort that requires a dedicated QA department. With the release of Cypress, we have a new standard in front-end testing that allows every developer to create acceptance tests. Come learn how you can create fast, easy, and reliable test for anything that runs in a browser regardless of the front-end framework used. You will walk away ready to end the era of “Developers don’t write acceptance tests” and start writing acceptance tests for all of your projects.

sessions.name: DBAS WORKING SMARTER NOT HARDER WITH POWERSHELL
sessions.description: Do you have extra time in your day to do extra things or to make things better? Feel overworked and wish you had time to actually do all of your job? This session is all about how you can manage your servers with tools that do not involve clicking. You have probably heard the phrase in the title, and that is just what this session is all about. Smarter means that you may make more use of tools rather than clicks. Smarter has the ability to scale with automation of those tools. Join me to find out how you can work smarter not harder using PowerShell and all the tools out there to support your desire. Join me in the quest to become a PowerShell DBA.

sessions.name: GET YOUR HEAD IN THE CLOUD
sessions.description: Cloud platforms such as Azure and AWS are still building their adoption, and you can find umpteen sessions on the technical details of these platforms. But, as a developer, what if your organization is still just looking at cloud capabilities? What if you’re just wondering how the cloud affects your life as a developer? This session starts with a brief assessment of what mainstream developers are really doing with the cloud now. Then it looks at some of the ways those developers will find the cloud useful in the next few years. Finally, presenter Billy Hollis brings out his crystal ball and explains upcoming cloud technology that will fuel extraordinary innovation in business apps, including things that don’t exist yet! Come get an entertaining take on how to think about current app development will evolve with the changes cloud technologies will bring.

sessions.name: GETTING STARTED WITH DEVOPS ON AZURE
sessions.description: In this session the basics of DevOps as practices will be examined. Time will be spent helping you get started on moving your teams away from their traditional silos. The session with then move toward the tooling in Microsoft’s cloud and how DevOps can be implemented for different types of deployments from IaaS to PaaS. Look for a demo filled session that will help jumpstart your move to DevOps in the Cloud. Takeaways: 1. Learn Core Principals DevOps 2. Discover the DevOps Tool Chain. 3. Get jumped started on how to use DevOps tools in Azure.

sessions.name: INCREASE YOUR .NET PRODUCTIVITY AND STREAMLINE AZURE DEVELOPMENT WITH VISUAL STUDIO 2019
sessions.description: Enabling developers to be productive, collaborate effectively, and support any kind of app development – including on Azure – has always been at the core of Microsoft’s vision. In this demo-heavy session, we’ll cover what’s new in Visual Studio 2019 including the new UX redesign, code cleanup, collaborating with Live Share, new .NET refactorings, AI-assisted development with Intellicode, and so much more! By the end of this session, you’ll be able to use the latest and greatest in Visual Studio 2019 to enhance your developer productivity.

sessions.name: LESSONS FROM THE FIELD: MIGRATING TO AN AZURE MODERN DATA WAREHOUSE
sessions.description: Migrating any mission critical Data Warehouse can be an intimidating task. The workloads often large, complex, and under scrutiny from CXOs. In this session, we will demonstrate how our "Success by Design" methodology, migration tools, and specialized resources increase the likelihood of project success by bringing the right process, people and tools to bear on the project. This session is a must see if you have a Data Warehouse project in the works or coming up. We will demo and take a deep dive into the various tools which save time, improve data quality, and improve customer’s migration experience. We will also present a variety of third-party tools available to facilitate smooth migrations.

sessions.name: LIGHTS, CAMERA, AI: INTERACTIVE CHAT BOTS
sessions.description: Smart lights, AI and you! Sounds like fun? Come learn how to train AI to understand commands and use the results to control lights and web interfaces. We'll tie everything together with a serverless application in Azure and an open chat channel using JavaScript. You'll leave with ideas on leveraging these tools for your own creative solutions.

sessions.name: MODERN .NET DESKTOP DEVELOPMENT IN .NET CORE 3
sessions.description: .NET Core 3 is coming and with it support for building WinForms and WPF applications for Windows Desktop. Get an in-depth look at porting desktop applications to .NET Core 3 including implications for tooling and custom controls, along with how to leverage the best of .NET Core from your desktop applications.

sessions.name: PYTORCH FOR .NET DEVELOPERS WITH AZURE MACHINE LEARNING
sessions.description: PyTorch is a Python-based scientific computing package that uses the power of modern GPUS. It is quickly becoming a preferred deep learning research platform built to provide maximum flexibility and speed using dynamic graph. In this talk we will show how Pytorch can be used on Azure using Azure Machine Learning service, Data Science Virtual Machine, Azure Notebooks, and Visual Studio Code Tools for AI. We will train PyTorch models with Azure Machine Learning service, and how we can use the ONNX runtime inside of our .NET applications. ONNX is a open format to represent deep learning models that is supported by various frameworks and tools. This format makes it easier to interoperate between frameworks and to maximize the reach of your hardware optimization investments.

sessions.name: TEMPDB: THE GOOD, THE BAD, AND THE UGLY
sessions.description: If you ask 100 SQL Server DBAs what their biggest headaches are, at least 99 of them will say something to do with TempDB. Over the years, there have been many different recommendations about configuration options for TempDB and they have changed over time. The behavior of TempDB has also changed over time. What hasn't changed is the criticality of TempDB and how its proper use and configuration can have major implications in the performance of your application. In this session we will discuss some of the improvements with TempDB in the latest versions of SQL Server and what good TempDB practices look like today. We will also discuss the improvements coming in SQL Server 2019 that will unlock scalability of TempDB-heavy workloads now and into the future.

sessions.name: VISUAL STUDIO CODE TIPS
WHAT'S NEW IN SQL SERVER 2019: 100% DEMOS
sessions.description: You haven't installed SQL Server 2019 yet, and you don't want to sit through a bunch of slides. You want to see a series of real-world demos focusing on the features of SQL Server 2019 that will make your users happier with as little work as possible on your part. You don't have time to rewrite all your queries or learn new languages - you just want the database to go faster. I'm Brent Ozar, and I'll give you the whirlwind tour. I'll focus on just the features that make the biggest bang for the buck, things you can implement right away and see a noticeable difference. I'll show you what kinds of code will benefit the most so you can go back to the office and have an honest discussion with management about what to expect. No slides here - not even an about-me slide. Let's dive into some queries!

sessions.name: CLIENT TO CLOUD: SYNCHRONIZING THE IN-BROWSER DATABASE WITH THE SERVER
sessions.description: Working with in-browser databases gives you the opportunity to save large amounts of data without ever needing to contact the server, but for many applications the data can't just stay on the client. In Client to the Cloud, you learn to bridge the gap between local and server data by synchronizing IndexedDB to a remote database. By the end of this session you learn how to set up the databases on both sides of the network as well as strategies for dealing with changes coming from both the cloud and the client.

sessions.name: Break
AUTOMATED DELIVERY FOR .NET APPLICATIONS
sessions.description: Implementing an automated delivery process for your applications could seem like daunting, complicated task. In this session, we will cover how you can create build and deploy process that will help you streamline delivery and most importantly, make things predictable. If you're currently in the process of setting up a delivery process for your applications, you'll want to attend this sessions and participate in the conversation!

sessions.name: COLUMNSTORE INDEXES: A JOURNEY INTO DATA WAREHOUSING PERFORMANCE
sessions.description: Come and learn how ColumnStore Indexes (CSI's), can speed up your Data Warehouse aggregations, summations and star-joins. I will be doing an intro and deep dive into the inner workings of ColumnStore indexes; how they work, key characteristics, dos and don'ts, restrictions, and more. Additionally, I will have insight into how CSI's have been updated in SQL Server 2016 and beyond. If you are a production DBA who needs to find out more about some of the additional hot features that have been included with CSI's, like batch mode processing and data segments, then this session is for you. If you are a BI DBA or developer who needs to find out how CSI's can increase the performance of your aggregations and star-joins by up to 40 times, then this session is also for you.

sessions.name: CONQUERING CONCURRENCY
sessions.description: There is so much more to writing faster SQL Server applications than just tacking on a NOLOCK hint to queries. This session will thoroughly discuss what isolation levels mean in the SQL Server universe, how interaction between resources occurs in each isolation level as well as different adverse effects to each isolation level. The session will include the common SQL Server isolation levels as well as the lesser-known optimistic isolation levels as well as how multi-version concurrency control works with In-Memory OLTP.

sessions.name: DRIVE INTELLIGENCE FROM TEXT COMPREHENSION IN ENTERPRISE APPS
sessions.description: Natural language understanding and processing has revolutionized the way we deal with unstructured data within an enterprise. This talk provides a comprehensive overview of variety of text mining techniques including Q&A (Dr. Q&A, BERT, Stanford BiDAF), classification, summarization, topic modeling, annotation, and contract analysis. Along with Microsoft Cognitive Services, the session covers how to use machine learning libraries to drive insights and intelligence in your applications and covers how to work with unstructured text and turn unstructured text into meaningful insights into mobile, web and line of business applications. In this code-focused session, we will demonstrate how to use a few lines of code to easily analyze sentiment, extract key phrases, detect topics, and detect language for any kind of text. The techniques include TF-IDF, LDA, Word2Vec, Doc2Vec, word embedding, BERT, ELMO, and BiDAF etc. to showcase their use in enterprise applications with real world use cases.

sessions.name: MICROSOFT IDENTITY PLATFORM FOR DEVELOPERS
sessions.description: Come to this session to learn how Microsoft Identity platform helps you with your app’s access and security. Topics discussed include: Multi-tenant vs single-tenant apps with Azure Active Directory and Microsoft accounts, B2C, B2B, and optimizing permissions and consent. Explore how your app fits in with external identities, and which development tools and libraries are right for your app scenario.

sessions.name: POLYBASE++ IN SQL SERVER 2019
sessions.description: What is Polybase? Launched first in SQL Server 2016, Polybase in SQL Server 2019 provides a robust data virtualization solution to reduce the need for ETL and data movement. Come learn how new data connectors work with sources like Oracle, CosmosDB, Azure SQL Database, Hadoop, and SAP HANA. Come also learn how Polybase is a central piece to the SQL Server 2019 Big Data Cluster data analytics solution.

sessions.name: RUNNING AKS IN PROD
sessions.description: In this session, you will go behind the lines of a real AKS deployment into production. Lessons learned about Infrastructure, Networking, Key Vault, WAF, and AKS will be covered. Learn how we locked down the deployment from the Network Security Groups to RBAC on the containers. You will see how Azure DevOps was used to create a true end to end CI/CD for both the Application and Infrastructure. Our pain, your gain… Takeaways: 1. Best practices for deploying production application with AKS 2. Use Azure DevOps pipelines and Terraform to manage an AKS deployment 3. Secure your AKS deployment (edited) (edited)

sessions.name: SQL SERVER 2017 AND AZURE SQL DB: SECURITY SMACKDOWN
sessions.description: In this session we will cover and demo the many security features in SQL Server 2017/2019 such as Row Level Security, Dynamic and Static Data Masking, Always Encrypted, Advanced Threat Detection, and the Azure Security Center covering SQL Server 2017+ and Azure SQL Database / Managed Instance. Row-Level Security enables customers to control access to rows based on the characteristics of the user executing a query. RLS enables you to implement restrictions on data row access. For example, ensuring that users can access only those data rows that are pertinent to their department, or restricting a customer's data access to only the data relevant to their company. Dynamic Data Masking limits (DDM) sensitive data exposure by masking it to non-privileged users. It can be used to greatly simplify the design and coding of security in your application. We will also cover the new capability of Static Data Masking that allows users to create a masked copy of a database. This helps organizations that need to share sensitive data across teams or with other external parties such as vendors and support. Always Encrypted is another feature designed to protect sensitive data stored in Azure SQL Database or SQL Server databases. Always Encrypted allows clients to encrypt sensitive data inside client applications and never reveal the encryption keys to the Database Engine (Azure SQL Database or SQL Server). A new capability in SQL Server 2019 is Always Encrypted with secure enclaves. With secure enclaves, Always Encrypted protects the confidentiality of sensitive data while providing in-place encryption capabilities and allows improved performance operations on encrypted columns including pattern matching and range comparisons Finally, Azure SQL Database Threat Detection provides security by detecting activities which may indicate a threat such as SQL injection attacks. The benefits of Azure Threat Detection include configuration of SQL threat detection policy, email alerts upon detection, and Azure Portal and Microsoft Excel integration. All of these technologies can be used together to create a solid defense-in-depth strategy. We will cover these security features with an in-depth, demo focused delivery covering Azure SQL Database and SQL Server 2017/2019 on-prem.

sessions.name: THE 8 MOST COMMON WAYS DEVELOPERS GET UX WRONG
sessions.description: Most developers have zero training in creating effective user experiences, so it's not surprising that they make mistakes. In this session, Billy Hollis will go through the most common UX mistakes he’s seen in business applications. Some of them include crowded screens, layout that’s too static, poor use of color, and failure to visualize data. In each case, there will be an example of the problem, with one or more alternatives that move towards fixing the problem. This will be an interactive session, with attendees encouraged to rate the alternatives and suggest their own ideas, and with a healthy question and answer session at the end.

sessions.name: THE CLOUD-NATIVE COOKBOOK: SERVERLESS, KUBERNETES, AND CONTAINERS
sessions.description: How do I navigate and architect in a cloud native world? The next generation of apps will be built faster and scale further than ever before. Cloud native apps give developers the opportunity to build apps that fully take advantage of the benefits of the modern cloud. This session will help explain the key components and strengths of cloud native technology like serverless functions and Kubernetes, how they can work together, and how you can decide how best to build the apps of the future.

sessions.name: ULTIMATE PRESENTATION FORMULA FOR NERDS
sessions.description: As a techie, we need to be able to talk to more than just 1s and 0s. Talking to computers is great but we also need to be able to talk to humans and give an effective presentations if we want to be seen as the go to expert. Join me in this interactive session to get the critical techniques I used to grow from 0 talks to giving 200+ talks at over 75 events around the world. Public speaking just like talking is a skill that can be learned with the right training and mentorship. Being shy and introverted doesn't have to doom you to a life of only talking to computers even though it is really cool to talk to computers. You will walk away inspired to share your knowledge and be seen as the go to expert.

sessions.name: YOUR .NET APP WON’T SCALE
sessions.description: Developers are tasked with writing code that results in passing tests, delivered features, and blistering performance under any size load. A well-intentioned developer working on a slow app can employ a variety of tricks to increase performance - adding async, parallelism, or creative use of multiple threads. These powerful tricks are tools that can - when understood and used wisely - greatly improve the overall experience of your app. They can also be misused in such a way that they serve as time bombs that lead to intermittently crashing apps, lost data, or vulnerabilities. In this session, Glenn Condron from the .NET Core team, will show you the errors of your ways and make sense out of these techniques and when they're useful - or when they should be avoided. If you've ever found yourself awake at night worried that your recent commits have made your app better - or more brittle - but had no idea to ask, don't miss this valuable session.

sessions.name: ANGULAR: REACTIVE FORMS
sessions.description: Reactive forms is the best way to write forms in Angular. In this workshop, we will implement a multi-step form with varied inputs including reusable form groups, date pickers, drop-downs with type-ahead support, form arrays, custom form controls with input masking implementing ControlValueAccessor and doing validation as your form spans multiple components.

sessions.description: Hosted by Carl Franklin and Richard Campbell

sessions.name: A PAINLESS INTRODUCTION TO USER EXPERIENCE DESIGN
sessions.description: You know you should care about UX design. But you likely think it's a boring subject and you're not suited for it anyway. You're probably wrong on both counts. Most developers can learn the basics of UX design, and if you do it in this workshop, you'll have fun along the way. What other workshop will feature pink flamingos, Mr. Meeseeks, asteroids, moon-walking bears, Creepy Watson, and a developer snorting code off the screen? So come and learn the design principles that help you judge good and bad design, with visuals that ensure you'll remember them, plus a lightweight design process to help you put those principles to use. Come ready to participate in hands-on design exercises, alone and in groups. Come have some fun, and walk out with some tangible ways to make your users' lives better.

sessions.name: ANGULAR ARCHITECTURE
sessions.description: Workshop will have some hands-on aspects. Bring your own fully charged laptop. A lot of questions typically come up as developers write application code. For example, are you following established best practices? How easy will it be to maintain and refactor the application in the future? If you're starting a new application from scratch, what application architecture should be used? These types of questions are common when building any type of application especially when you're focused on meeting a deadline. While there's a lot of information out there about the core concepts of Angular, very little focuses on architectural concepts, best practices, and how to solve some of the more challenging tasks that come up. That's the purpose of this workshop. The Angular Architecture and Best Practices workshop will provide guidance to help you think through the process of building a solid application architecture that is easy to refactor and maintain. Some of the topics covered include: • Planning your application architecture • General best practices • Structuring features and modules • Component communication • Using Subjects • State management • Performance optimizations • More… Come join us for a day of in-depth discussions and hands-on examples of different architecture concepts and best practices that can be applied to your Angular applications.

sessions.name: APPLICATION BUILDING WITH ASP.NET CORE 2.2
sessions.description: Bring your own fully charged laptop, as this workshop will have hands-on aspects. In this workshop, Jeff from the ASP.NET Core team will guide you through building multi-tier applications using ASP.NET Core. You'll learn about the latest improvements in 2.2 to build APIs, with Open API and authorization support, then build a front-end app and deploy the entire thing to Azure, making optimizations for the cloud environment along the way. Attendees will need to bring a fully-charged laptop with the following setup: • Windows: Visual Studio 2017, 2019 or Visual Studio Code • Mac/Linux: VS Code

sessions.name: AZURE IOT BOOTCAMP
sessions.description: Workshop will have hands-on aspects. Bring your own fully charged laptop. While IoT is a relative newcomer to the technology landscape, it is important to note that it is not emerging, it is already here! IoT is a booming market which is growing at an incredible pace. According to research published by Zinnov, they estimate IoT expenditures will increase from $201 billion in 2018 to $500 billion in 2023. Other lofty projections from large companies such as Accenture, GE and CISCO predict that it will become a $14 trillion dollar industry by 2030. In the near future, use of IoT will be assumed, and practices will differentiate by their skill in the pragmatic application of IoT. Interestingly, the IoT market today is still largely open, with many organizations just beginning to understand the capabilities and explore the use of IoT. Of 743 survey participants in an MDC Research study, only 16% of partners reported having an IoT solution in production today. This makes IoT a lucrative market for business and consultancies alike. In this workshop, you will learn about Azure IoT offerings while building a prototype device from scratch and connecting it to the cloud. We will begin by imaging a Raspberry Pi development board with Windows IoT Core and build out a hardware solution using a sensor. We will then build a UWP application that will allow us to read and view the values obtained from the sensor. From there we will register and connect our device to Azure using the IoT Hub. Telemetry data will start flowing to Azure where we will see the values being received in real time, and develop alerts and reports that make sense based on this data. We will utilize IoT Twins and Edge in demonstrating the use of the Cloud and IoT in a particle fashion. We will also discuss the importance of other Azure services in an IoT system such as analytics, dashboards, mobile applications, and artificial intelligence. Join us in this immersive, hands-on IoT workshop and learn by doing. What you need to bring to the bootcamp: • micro-usb cabl • MicroSD card (adapter) - 8GB Minimum, Class 10 or better • SD Card reader • USB keyboard(required) • USB Mouse (optional) • Microsoft Azure Account • Small Philips head screwdriver (possibly depends on screen) • Visual Studio 2017 or 2019 community (all updates installed) Every attendee will receive a Raspberry Pi3, Water sensor and other hardware needed to build an IoT Device to communicate with their own IoTHub in the Azure Cloud.

sessions.name: PWA: USING THE WEB PLATFORM POWER TO THE FULLEST
sessions.description: Bring your own fully charged laptop, as this workshop will have hands-on aspects. Level: 300 Web Platform is amazing. It becomes more and more performant, feature-rich while keeping its universal nature. We call “progressive” the web apps we build using the latest browser APIs, allowing us to achieve a totally new level of the user experience. On this workshop, we’ll focus on what Workbox as a network tasks automation library contributes to the PWA idea. During the full day of training you will learn about: PWA concept pillars, Service Worker API fundamentals, current platform’s PWA support (and workarounds when needed), and Workbox library - the industry standard in the automation of PWA tasks. I share lots of practical tips & tricks, both technical and UX, review real-life PWA examples, explain how to avoid common pitfalls, and how to deal with edge cases. On the practical side, I empower you to build a Progressive Web Application. We start from the “regular” application, and in the form of discrete, documented steps I guide you on how to add PWA features one-by-one using Workbox. As a result, everyone will have a fully-featured, installable PWA ready to delight its users by offline experience, optimized networking and push notifications. We are not about hitting the numbers – we are about providing the extra value for our users, but 100% score in the Lighthouse is also guaranteed! After all, for you to get prepared for the next steps, I introduce what’s new coming to PWA-related APIs and what’s on Workbox roadmap. Course overview: • Introduction to PWA and Workshop Setup • Introduction to Workbox • Creating MVP PWA • External resources caching • Setting up runtime caching • Web App Manifest and Adding to Home Screen • Implementing push notifications • Replaying offline requests using Background sync • Providing better UX for app update flow • Future development of PWA and Workbox • Questions and answers Expected level: • Basic knowledge of JavaScript is required • The knowledge of any framework(s) is not required Pre-requisites: You need a laptop with installed (latest stable versions) Git, Node, NPM, and browsers (latest stable versions) Chrome / Firefox / Edge (on Windows). A week before the workshop you will receive a link with the initial repo to clone and detailed setup instructions.

sessions.name: SQL SERVER REPORTING SERVICES AND POWER BI REPORTING SOLUTIONS
sessions.description: Join Microsoft Technical Specialist David Pless and Principal Consultant Tim Radney as we explore the capabilities of Power BI desktop, hybrid reporting, and the new capabilities of Power BI Premium and Report Server. In today’s ever maturing world of enterprise reporting, self-service business intelligence, and data science we must be ready to quickly analyze and visualize data anywhere. With Power BI, self-service capabilities has expanded to all data-workers beyond enterprise reporting to mobile platforms, embedded application solutions, as well as advanced analytics. With Power BI Premium and Report Server, we now have a scalable solution where dedicated hardware powers scheduled cloud-based reporting and where Power BI Report Server brings self-service cloud capabilities on-prem. In this workshop, we will focus on these capabilities along with SQL Server Reporting Services and Mobile Report Publisher. We will cover improvements to paginated reporting, interactive and mobile reporting, KPIs, dashboards, and other new features in SQL Server 2017 / 2019. We will demo dashboard brand control, Microsoft Office integration, performance analysis and best practices, monitoring reporting performance, and High Availability and scale-out for reporting architectures. We will also cover application scenarios with Power BI embedded, Power BI Apps, and scenarios with Advanced Analytics including forecasting, built-in insights, data cluster analysis, and Narrative Science. Key areas include SSRS and Power BI Report Server features, Power BI reports and dashboards, report scheduling and deployment, custom visuals, and application use cases. We will focus on the latest features and the most impactful reporting capabilities along with best practices from the field.

sessions.name: ZERO TO HERO: FASTER SQL QUERY PERFORMANCE
sessions.description: A lot of performance problems with SQL Server can often be avoided through proper design and coding. This full day seminar will look at common design and coding patterns that introduce performance problems in SQL Server. The session will highlight important aspects of SQL Server that developers should know to get faster performance and avoid having performance problems. If you want to know how to identify performance problems, anti-patterns to avoid, and alternatives that scale you won't want to miss this session. We will look at how to use the plan cache, and/or Query Store to find existing performance anti-patterns and use the information contained to identify common problems about the queries that are running against the system. By focusing on real-world examples with reproducible workloads, you will easily be able to see the impact of simple changes that eliminate common performance problems and learn how to fix them quickly for improved performance from the least amount of effort.
